New Records: The Toronto Raptors dropped to 2-8, becoming the first team in the NBA to lose 8 games this season.
Key Match Events: The Raptors mounted an 18-6 run in the fourth quarter to tie the game at 93.
Norman Powell's trifecta gave the Clippers a 100-95 lead with two minutes left.
Immanuel Quickley tied the game at 102 with 35 seconds remaining.
James Harden's free throws gave the Clippers a two-point lead, and RJ Barrett missed a layup on the subsequent possession.
Bruno Fernando's impact led to a critical defensive stop and a key basket by Chris Boucher.
Coach Darko Rajakovic's decision to bench Jakob Poeltl was criticized, and Poeltl missed a crucial shot to seal the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Darko Rajakovic's questionable decisions and crunch-time struggles were criticized after the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a back-and-forth affair for most of the first three quarters.
The Clippers' perimeter shooting and foul-bait strategy were highlighted as key factors in their victory.
